meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Two Hospitalized With Virus Two elderly women have become seriously ill with the mosquito-borne West Nile virus. The city will intensify its pesticide spraying over the weekend.
Two Hospitalized With Virus Two elderly women have become seriously ill with the mosquito-borne West Nile virus. The city will intensify its pesticide spraying over the weekend.
Israeli Premier's Warning Ehud Barak warned of ''tragedy'' ahead for Israel and the Palestinians if they do not reach a peace accord, and hinted that he fears a return to Islamic terrorist attacks.
Outlook Dim on Extremism Foreign Minister Joschka Fischer predicted pessimistically that it would take a ''generation and a half'' to eradicate rightist extremism in eastern Germany.
Kashmir Paradox She knows that many in the West might consider her a contradiction: a fervent feminist and conservative Muslim, demanding equal rights from behind her veil.
Agreement on Indian Bank Eleven Indian tribes or tribal corporations have agreed to commit $1 million each to found the nation's largest intertribal bank. It would be based in Denver.
Can History Revive? After decades of special-interest scholarship, some scholars are asking if American history can ever again be viewed as a whole.
